instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00245: What is 820-00245? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00245</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power
threads.message: Got this Mac in company said they replaced the battery and had no power. I get 1.7 volts on CPU VCore, but I get no chime no screen light anything. The CPU gets REALLY warm. Is this trash or where do I begin? This is the 1st 12" I've ever opened.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00245</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power
threads.message: Oh and board has absolutely no signs of liquid damage itâ€™s clean as could be.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00245</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power
threads.message: These CPUs should stay almost cold. So I bet the CPU is shorted and thus heating up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00245</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power
threads.message: Ok gotcha Duke thanks! Just wanted to make sure, so I didn't waste too much time if the CPU was screwed.
